Draw segmentation

Source: R/coldcuts.R
seg_draw.Rd

Creates a `segmentation` object from an array or a `NIfTI` file

seg_draw(
  nifti_file = NULL,
  nrrd_file = NULL,
  array = NULL,
  molten_array = NULL,
  ontology = NULL,
  ontology_file = NULL,
  outliers = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE,
  directions_from = "RAS",
  directions_to = "RAS",
  planes = "all",
  subset_structures = NULL,
  draw_outline = TRUE,
  subset_sagittal = NULL,
  subset_coronal = NULL,
  subset_axial = NULL,
  reference_space = NULL,
  citation = NULL,
  parallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

nifti_file

a character string pointing to the NIfTI file address. Default is NULL
nrrd_file

a character string pointing to the NRRD file address. Default is NULL
array

a 3D array containing structure annotations (optional if nifti_file and molten_array are not specified). Default is NULL
molten_array

an array in molten form, such as the result of reshape2::melt() (optional if nifti_file and array are not specified). Default is NULL
ontology

an object containing the segmentation ontology (e.g. from another segmentation). Default is NULL
ontology_file

a character string pointing to the ontology .csv or .txt file address. Default is NULL
outliers

a numeric vector indicating outlier points to be eliminated before drawing polygons. Default is NULL
verbose

logical, should messages on the process be displayed? Default is TRUE
directions_from

character, indicates the original orientation of the array. Default is "RAS" (Left to Right, Posterior to Anterior, Inferior to Superior).
directions_to

character, indicates the final orientation of the array. The array is rotated only if it is different from directions_from. Default is "RAS", which results in the proper assignment of axis labels.
planes

character, either "all" (default) or any subset of "sagittal", "coronal", and "axial". Determines along which axes the array wil be sliced.
subset_structures

character vector, structures to be subset for the segmentation. Default is NULL
draw_outline

logical, should the outline of the whole array be drawn? Default is `TRUE`
subset_sagittal

numeric vector, indicates a subset of slices along the sagittal plane that will be drawn. Default is NULL
subset_coronal

numeric vector, indicates a subset of slices along the coronal plane that will be drawn. Default is NULL
subset_axial

numeric vector, indicates a subset of slices along the axial plane that will be drawn. Default is NULL
reference_space

character, what reference space does this segmentation use, e.g. "MNI152", "CCFv3", "JFRC2010". Default is NULL
citation

list of character strings, what is the citation for this segmentation? Default is NULL.
parallel

logical, should the polygons be drawn using parallel processing? Uses future.apply::future_lapply(), so the proper setup must be done beforehand. Default is FALSE.

Value

a `segmentation` S4 object.

Contents

Developed by Giuseppe D'Agostino, Sarah Langley.
